subject: Notification!
body:
Notification!
The Wells Fargo Bank U.S. is here to inform you of your file submitted
by the International Monetary Fund (IMF), although it is an inherited
specific fund related to disease control, quarantine measures and drug
standardization of the League of Nations Health Organization,
officially here to you of the current one Winners Prize/Covid-19
Palliative Fund payment agreement that includes you as the lucky ones.
Therefore, we choose to pay you via a digitized payment system by
opening an online bank account on your behalf. We have decided to pay
you the sum of 1,500,000.00 Euros (one million five hundred thousand
Euros) through Wells Fargo's online bank.
 But before we proceed, you
need to confirm your full name and provide one of your ID's as the
online account here is opened by Wells Fargo Bank with this
information.
 You will then receive your access data and the amount of
1,500,000.00 Euros will be transferred to your online account.
This agreement was initiated/constituted by the World Health
Organization, the United Nations and the International Monetary Fund
due to the coronavirus, the Covid-19 pandemic and others to help you
and others. 
The policy guiding this fund is that once you receive the
fund, you must donate 25 percent to the charity.
Below you will find the information necessary for the opening
1) Your full name.....?
2) 
your ID card
....?
3) Your address
4) Your Telephone
5) Your hometown/country of origin....?
6) Your age.....?
7) Your gender male or female....?
8) Your profession civil servant or businessman....?
Best regards
Charles W Sharp
Email: 
customercare8093@outlook.com
Managing Director of Wells Fargo Bank

subject: Re: Notification!
body:
Hello Charles Sharp,

Wow, this is such an unexpected surprise! I can't believe I'm one of the lucky ones. It's really kind of you and your organization to help people during these tough times. 

I'm curious about the digitized payment system you mentioned. How does it work? And how secure is it? Also, could you tell me more about the charity donation part? Which charities are eligible for this?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best wishes,
John
